author: dvd
title: ADA water solutions in Africa
description: Retail bottled water has a low/no mineral content leading to poor hydration and fatigue. No Ada payments currently in my business.

f6_assessments.q0: ADA water solutions in Africa is a good idea to be able to bring clean water to more people. Making it possible for the community to use ADA to pay for water purchases will help bring the Cardano application to life closer. This can also help many people know that they can use ADA to pay for the simplest and most necessary things in daily life.
f6_assessments.q1: Anushka, Jacques Otto, Marna Otto, and Dirk were all passionate people. However, I regret not to find any information about your experience and skills. I think you need to share it with the community, maybe through Linkerdin, Telegram, Twitter, ... or any website so that the community can better understand you. In addition, you also need to talk more about the risks that could make this proposal unsuccessful. For example, the use of cryptocurrency to pay for goods in some countries is prohibited because it is not allowed to replace fiat money. So does the law in your place have any influence on this or not? Moreover, the integration of payments by ADA, which solution will you use for this? I believe that if you can solve these problems, the community will appreciate it much more.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap you have given is quite clear, but you need to clarify some financial expenses. For example, $10,000 for a consulting team is to spend on how many consultants? In how long? How does $10,000 label stocks and specific products?... In addition, you also need to put KPIs in a clearer and more specific way in numbers so that the community can easily measure. Example: How many people will use ADA to pay for water? … I hope you guys will do better next time

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal will help the proposers bottled water company to expand and accept ada payments. They have clearly defined the problem, and the solution, and this proposal would help to drive awareness of Cardano in Africa. The budget includes 10 000: stock and product labelling + distribution via courier and gas costs, so it is assumed the bottles will contain Cardano branding to help spread awareness of Cardano ADA. While this business may benefit from the funding and be able to scale up operations to increase its reach, it is not clear if this funded work can benefit other similar businesses in the cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer is able to show relevant experience, and as the business owner they will be in charge of this implementation. It is not clear who the proposer will hire to implement the payment solution, or if they have the in house technical ability to do so, however the technical challenges should not be insurmountable. They have listed in the budget:

 USD 10 000: Consulting team - IOHK PSG team 
USD 1000:  Website R10k dev + design and payment arrangement in ADA

Yet in the proposal it is not clear if they have been able to secure consulting services from IOHK or if IOHK has agreed to take on this work.
The consulting fees are significant while the website design and ada payment gateway are only 1000, which seems a little low for this project. 
There is a list of actionable steps, a detailed budget breakdown and reasonable timeline to complete the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal has provided clear auditability metrics, in the form of deliverables and a timeline. The cardano community will be able to evaluate success by reviewing the company website to confirm ada payments are being accepted, and by reviewing the product packaging and social media marketing campaigns.

f6_assessments.q0: The water problem in Africa is the one to deal with this challenge. Water is very important to people, but the retail water bottles here have high mineral content leading to hydration that affects their health. The idea of ​​bringing Ada to liquidity during the sale is a good idea that both helps businesses grow and helps people understand more about the ecosystem running on ADA. . With a simple explanation, people only need a phone to be able to use clean water through Cardano or a reputable website. This challenge both helps businesses grow and exposes the African community to ADA and cryptocurrency so that the community can assess its link to the challenge. The author also highlights the risks and potential challenges that will be encountered. The ideas presented are great it effectively solves the challenge, if funded I believe it will have a good impact on making more people aware of Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: It is proposed to define clear milestones of well-designed activities, detailed roadmaps, and timelines divided into 5 months per month with each roadmap detailed enough to accomplish the goals. The budget to which the project applies is $28,500. The author has detailed each expenditure in a clear and specific way. Especially here, I see that the author has a budget of $ 2,000, enough to see that the author calculates very carefully and lists the contingency budget. The proposal is well structured and clear, the budget is broken down into expenditures that I find perfectly reasonable. The group consists of many members who are assigned specific jobs, suitable for each individual. Here I see the author mentioned the fan page "https://www.facebook.com/Say-Yes-103383311644322" clearly stating the product's activities on it to increase the product's reliability. But the project will present even better if there are more LinkedIn, Twitter ... members, the credibility for the group will be more.
f6_assessments.q2: The indicators are listed by the author over 4 months. Success metrics and criteria can be easily measured through to-dos for each month. The roadmap and time seem reasonable, but successfully integrating Ada payments into the business requires people to go through it more time, with no real metrics provided to measure success. This project is a brand new project and is awaiting funding.

f6_assessments.q0: From the information provided it is stated that you want to incorporate ADA payment into your business. This idea if well and successfully implemented  will have a great positive impact on the cardano ecosystem but the issue am having with the proposal is that most of the implementation plans stated are in the future.  The proposer team are not focusing on how  this is going to be done like the  step to step plans on how the project is going to achieve and the key metrics and goals the proposal is not aligning with the outlined challenge setting. The challenges like the government regulations , the progresses you made so far on how to tackle them etc. You research and findings etc. I will recommend you include this for better chance of having your proposal funded. This is the reason am rating the proposal with score of 3
f6_assessments.q1: The link (https://www.facebook.com/Say-Yes-103383311644322) provided by the team shows the product ( bottled water) that they want to incorporate ADA payment with. It did not show us the skill and experience needed to implement the proposal. The team stated the names of the members and the role they will play in the proposal but there is no well outline experience of the members showing that the team is capable of handling the project. The budget of 28500 is reasonable and broken down into identifiable items but I believe the team can define a more detailed breakdown of the fund e.g USD10 000: Consulting team - IOHK PSG team, I would like it if you go further to explain how many people involved like ( USD10, 000 for 5 members of the consulting team) for a better understanding. A realistic time line of 2, 3 to 4 months and more for the execution of the proposal. Also like I mentioned  above am not seeing a sensible and conductive plan for implementation  that is show me what is being done but how , so I recommend you look into this points for better review.
f6_assessments.q2: The team provided a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon of only 1 to 4 months without mentioning how to keep updating the community  after the mentioned period of time. The metrics and kpis that measures the success of the proposal is not stated. Also in the proposal the team was able to give us a clear understanding of the targeted problem which is incorporating Cardano ADA payment its business using 'say yes' bottled water as case study but there is no detailed solution provided to address this problem.  Therefore I rate audit with 3 meaning that I neither agree nor disagree that this proposal provided me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

solution: High mineral content in water leads to adequate hydration. Include Ada payments into sales process.
experience: Entrepreneur, financial advisor, business owner of “say yes” water. No ADA payment integration experience.
